page.title: 03OLD VILLAGE DOWNDERRY
page.content: MUCH OF THE ORIGINAL VILLAGE OF DOWNDERRY WAS DEVELOPED ON THIS COASTAL STRIP.THE FLAT LAND ON THE CLIFF TOP PROVIDED GOOD AGRICULTURAL LAND EASY TO WORK,CLOSE TO A SOURCE OF FERTILIZER AND SUPPORTED BY A LARGELY FROST FREE CLIMATE.THE FARM WORKERS AND FISHERMEN WERE HOUSED IN A NUMBER OF SMALL COTTAGES NOW USED BY PENSIONERS OR FOR HOLIDAY HOMES.LATER LARGER HOUSES OF ARTISANS FRINGE THE STRIP.THESE OFTEN WERE THE BOARDING HOUSES EARLY THIS CENTURY. UNTIL 1890 THE OLD PUB WAS THE ONLY PLACE OF ENTERTAINMENT THEN THE WORKING MENS CLUB AND READING ROOM WAS FORMED AS AN ALTERNATIVE.THE W.M.C. REMAINS AS THE MAJOR HALL FOR VILLAGE ACTIVITY.SALES, SPORTS,PLAYS,MEETINGS ALL VIE FOR ROOM ON THE TIMETABLE.IN THIS YEAR{1985}THE CLUBROOM IS HAVING A MAJOR OVERHAUL TO MAINTAIN & IMPROVE THE PREMISES.
